seo.description: Compare eDiscovery software options for law firms and legal teams. See how AI-native tools like Dodonai offer semantic search and document review at a fraction of legacy platform costs.

hero.headline: eDiscovery Software Review: Finding the Right Fit for Your Firm
hero.subheadline: Legacy eDiscovery platforms cost $50,000 or more per year and were built for a pre-AI world. Modern, AI-native alternatives like Dodonai offer semantic search, automated document review, and production-ready exports at a fraction of the cost. Here is what to look for when choosing eDiscovery software.

sections.heading: What to Look for in eDiscovery Software
paragraphs: Choosing eDiscovery software is one of the most consequential technology decisions a litigation team can make. The right platform accelerates document review, reduces costs, and helps attorneys find the evidence that matters. The wrong one locks you into expensive contracts, buries critical documents in keyword-only search results, and creates bottlenecks during production deadlines.

The most important capability to evaluate is search quality. Traditional eDiscovery platforms rely on keyword and Boolean search, which means you only find documents that contain the exact terms you specify. AI-native platforms like {{link:/electronic-discovery-software/|Dodonai}} use semantic search to find documents based on meaning, not just matching words. This catches relevant documents that keyword search misses — synonyms, paraphrased concepts, and contextual references that are often the most important evidence in a case.

Cost is the other critical factor. Legacy eDiscovery platforms from vendors like Relativity, Everlaw, and Nuix typically require annual contracts starting at $50,000 or more, plus per-gigabyte hosting fees and additional charges for analytics features. For solo practitioners, small firms, and mid-size litigation teams, these costs are prohibitive. AI-native alternatives offer comparable or superior functionality at monthly price points that make eDiscovery accessible to any practice.

faq.question: How does semantic search differ from keyword search in eDiscovery?
faq.answer: Keyword search only returns documents containing the exact terms you enter. Semantic search understands the meaning behind your query and finds documents that discuss the same concepts using different words. For example, searching for 'employee safety complaints' with semantic search will also surface documents about 'worker injury reports' or 'staff health concerns' — results that keyword search would miss entirely.

faq.question: Can Dodonai replace a full eDiscovery platform like Relativity or Everlaw?
faq.answer: For many firms, yes. Dodonai provides the core eDiscovery capabilities that most litigation teams need: document ingestion, semantic and keyword search, AI-powered review and summarization, and export for production. For cases that require specialized features like predictive coding workflows or complex production templating, Dodonai can serve as a cost-effective complement to a legacy platform for the search and review phases.
